Top 10 Highest Paying Welding Jobs

June 9, 2021November 12, 2020 by Brayden
1.1k
SHARES
ShareTweet

Recently, careers in welding are gaining a lot of attention. Since ,they are highest paying welding jobs even among many white collar jobs.

Welding is the process of joining two or more metal parts together. There are many types of welding techniques including; MIG (Metal Inert Gas), TIG (Tungsten Inert Gas) and GMAW popularly known as Arc Welding and Stick welding.

Subsequently, the type of welding you specialize in effects the amount of money you can earn. So the rate of your pay and available opportunities widely vary in the welding industry and your skills.

If you don’t want to be stuck in a small welding shop and want to earn 5 times more than your skills then you should consider following highest paying welding jobs as career options for you.

If you are new in welding, you can also read our: Best Welder for Beginners

Top 10 Highest Paying Welding Jobs
1- Under Water Welding ($ 54,000 – 290,000)
2- RIG welders job ( $52,000 – $207,000)
3- Industrial Pipeline welding jobs ($ 35’500 – 106,000)
4- Military welding jobs ($ 150,000 +)
5– Aerospace welding jobs ($ 29,000 – 59,500)
6- Nuclear welding jobs ($70,000 +)
7- Welding supervisors jobs ($66,000 +)
8- Automobile welders jobs ($ 40,000 – 80,000)
9- Welding Engineers jobs ($51,000 – $120,000)
10 – Welding Inspector jobs ($42,000 – $104,000)

Top 10 Highest Paying Welding Jobs

We have drained out the highest paying welding jobs in the world which will get you a 6 digit revenue per month. Let’s take a dig at it:

1- Under Water Welding ($ 54,000 – 290,000)

Underwater welding is the most dangerous welding job. You will be required to work in extreme environments that can be life-threatening.

This is the exact reason why this is the highest paying welding job.  Along with welding certification, you will also be required to have commercial diving certification.

2- RIG welders job ( $52,000 – $207,000)

Rig welders are considered as one of the highest-paid welders in the world. In this welding job you will be required to work work long and difficult hours. Also you will need most advance educations and qualifications related to welding.

There is no room for mistakes, if by any chance a mistake is made it’s going to be lethargic, so RIG welding companies only hire the best welders for these positions.

3- Industrial Pipeline welding jobs ($ 35’500 – 106,000)

By the name of this high-end job, we can guess that it is related to industrial construction and pipeline installments. So, As an industrial pipeline welder, you’ll be responsible for constructing and repairing these pipelines.

This job will require a lot of travelling even out of the country. This means you’ll get to visit a lot of places and perform your work in different environments.

But sometimes traveling can take up a toll on you because you will be traveling to deserts and snow-covered areas.

4- Military welding jobs ($ 150,000 +)

Always keep this in mind the more dangerous the work environment will be the higher you will get paid. It shouldn’t be very surprising that working in a military setting will pay you a lot.

Not everyone is capable of working in this type of environment. Also you need to pass through intensive training before you can get such high end jobs.

5– Aerospace welding jobs ($ 29,000 – 59,500)

If you are looking for a job that does not require from you to travel a lot and want a low risk of death and injury then this might be the job for you.

It might not be a very high paying job but you will be earning a lot more than average welders.

6- Nuclear welding jobs ($70,000 +)

This is the kind of career which is quite dangerous and difficult to get since you will be cleared by the FBI itself. You might also be required to do underwater welding which is why you will also be needing a diving certification along with many other certifications.

7- Welding supervisors jobs ($66,000 +)

As the name implies it is a job of supervision. You will not be required to do a lot of welding. A supervisor is a person who heads or oversees the work being done on behalf of a company.  As a welding supervisor you will be responsible for the services of the welders. 

8- Automobile welders jobs ($ 40,000 – 80,000)

An automobile welder as the name implies usually conducts repairs on vehicles and even automobiles. This is an ideal job for cars and automobile lovers. For this job you must have the skills to design different metals.

9- Welding Engineers jobs ($51,000 – $120,000)

To be a welding engineer, firstly you will need a bachelor’s degree and respective certification from AWS to even start a career in this field. Secondly, you must possess a love for learning new information and keep your knowledge up to date. You must have full knowledge of all te welding techniques available.

10 – Welding Inspector jobs ($42,000 – $104,000)

AAs a certified welding inspector, you will not be required to do actual welding. It does not mean your work will be easy you will be responsible for all of the work done by other welders. It means you will require greater skills, knowledge and experience than any other welders in your company.

The Benefit of Experience

One thing is for sure that, where ever you go, with your revenue will increase with increased experience. Initially you might be able to earn $50,00 as an initial salary. You will be able to gain far more once you get more experience. The above mentioned certified welding jobs requires from one to have proper education and certification.

FAQ’s

It is a myth that welding is not for everyone but in reality you can learn welding as little as 6 months by taking various courses and diplomas. You can always enhance your skills with experience.

RIG and under water welding are the best welding jobs because they are the highest paying welding jobs available.

Professionals work around heavy machinery and tools that can be potentially dangerous and even life-threatening. They also work in challenging conditions, braving the elements as well as extreme heat and cold on job sites but not everyone is eligible for these jobs. Only those who have proper experience and certification can apply for these jobs.

Conclusion

Those days are long gone when welding was considered a laborer’s work. If you want to make a highly paid career out of welding, it might be the best decision ever. Welders are earning fortune in these high paying welding jobs.
